intro.headline: I'm Mark Anthony Pinero. I'm a full-stack developer from Los Angeles, California. I've been working on the open web back when Geocities was a thing and have been passionate about it since. I've worked with various online communities creating original, usable experiences.

projects.title: Navi: The Life Calendar
projects.details: Navi is a life calendar that maps out your life by months: every block is a month of your life, and every row is one year. By adding in significant events in your life, like graduating, getting a new job, getting married, it lets you view your life more objectively and without bias.

projects.title: K-Pop Recap
projects.details: K-Pop Recap is a news aggregator from the top Korean entertainment websites. As an avid K-pop fan, I know Korean entertainment news is basically a giant fire hose. I made K-Pop Recap to let you whitelist your favorite artists and allow you to only read the news you care about.

projects.title: Spaces
projects.details: Spaces is a geo-location app using the Foursquare API to find local cafes you can work at easily. It integrates with Leaflet.js for mapping functionality.

projects.title: Teebots
projects.details: Co-founded an apparel and merchandise brand from 2012-2014 which marketed towards niche Korean-pop communities. We produced over $50,000 in sales part-time.
